reviews.review_content:
Stuart Taylor is NOT a good professor. However nice and intelligent he may be, he brings absolutely no passion to discussion. He succeeded in rendering his class, "Reading Freud," boring, which is no easy task.
He acts uninterested and bored with everyone. 
The discussions were never deep enough, as though he didn't even really like Freud that much.
His assignments totally lacked creativity and when I approached him about a creative final project, he was dismissive and rude to me.
Workload:
One midterm that treats the readings like problem sets
One final paper that involves no analysis

Professor Taylor is a real nice guy who is actually interested in teaching the class, something that can't be said for some full time professors. He's not the most exciting character around, but if you have a reasonable amount of discussion, it works just fine. He's also really helpful outside of class and very knowledgeable about the topic. I'd definitely recommend the class. 
Workload:
One book a week, weekly ungraded response papers and a 5-10 page term paper. It's really not a lot of work at all.
